intro: Salacistis ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow tansymustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in certain regions.
